name: Baron Resort Sharm El Sheikh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel over Easter. It was very busy. As it was said in previous reviews, the rooms are big, the hotel and the area around the hotel are very clean. The pool is huge (there is also a separate children's pool) and the water there was very warm and pleasant. There is a big sandy beach, so our daughter (3 y.) enjoyed playing and building sandcastles and because the water is so shallow she spent lots of time in the sea instead of a pool. The facilities are generally good, but the gym is tiny (one treadmill, one bicycle, one stepper and a few weights), though it was almost always empty. The only real issue with this hotel was the food. It was ok (I did not hear anyone complain about any tummy upsets), but I would expect much better variety and quality (it just does not taste good) from a five star hotel. We tried Italian restaurant and I would not advise to have pizza there, it tasted like PizzaHut.
reviews.title: Good hotel but the food is not very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But overall, we enjoyed our stay there. With all that sun, sand and sea we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: fantastic red sea holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the outside the baron Resort is imposing rather than attractive. Built in the 1980s it is not one of the most beautiful of the South Sinai hotels but from the moment we arrived in the large reception area we were made to feel welcome in this well run establishment. Our room faced the mountains and was much cooler than those with a southerly view. It was a good size, very well equipped with efficient plumbing. The restaurants are varied and very good as were the pool and beach bars. It is very easy to charge everything to the room in this complex so there is no need to carry money unless you are going into Naama Bay. We found the staff in the hotel to be very pleasant and friendly. No request was ever too much trouble for them. Several of the staff remarked on how good a place to work this was. Receptionists were very efficient. Our room was kept immaculate by a very pleasant young lad - even the gardeners seemed to hope we were enjoying our holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled with family
reviews.text: None of the above would be unexpected from a 5 star hotel anywhere in the world. The Baron went a bit further than many. I got a birthday card and a basket of fruit (they had seen it was my birthday when we handed in our passports at reception) The General Manager spoke to us several times during our stay, checking that we were satisfied and came to see us off at the end - something he does almost every day.
reviews.title: good hotel for old pepole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They had previously booked into the Baron Palms Resort. My dad contacted the hotel directly to book myself into their room and was told there was no record of him due to stay in that hotel on their system - despite them booking their holiday some 12 months earlier. It transpired that they had been moved to the Baron Resort before they even arrived and without being informed of this.
reviews.title: Yet again - great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: As it turned out they were thankful that they were moved - the Baron Resort is a lot more luxurious than the Palms. There is a lot more room around the pool area and more facilities and a larger main restaurant.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel, Amazing staff, exceptional service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Baron Resort was spotlessly clean - from the pool area to the rooms. There were a few problems at the Beach Bar with dirty glasses but what more can you expect when there is one member of staff serving and cleaning the glasses by hand.
reviews.title: one of the best hotel in Sharm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: After staying at this wonderful hotel, we returned to The Baron Resort for a second visit this summer and were not disappointed! Our stay, the staff and service were exemplary. The management work hard to elicit feedback from guests and even arrange cocktail parties at which you are encouraged to give your views about your holiday and how it could be improved. Points are taken on board and acted upon which was very refreshing.
reviews.title: This hotel is a heavenly haven; with a sublime setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were given a warm welcome on our return and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. During our stay the Presidents of Pakistan and Sri Lanka were residents at the time of our holiday, while attending an international conference. This says much for the calibre of the hotel and how it is perceived nationally.
reviews.title: The best hotel we've ever stayed in....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: A special thank you to The Manager Mr Klaleb who clearly recognises that in terms of customer service - quality is a journey and not a destination. He continually works to improve the customer experience. Mr Mohammed Mamoun, executive manager, also made our stay something to remember. His smiling face, warm yet professional manner with guests and staff ensured the highest of standards at mealtimes throughout our holiday. Thanks to all for a wonderful holiday which I intend to repeat soon.
reviews.title: Wow what a Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well, where to start?? From the moment we entered the reception area the fantastic service started. Everyone who works here from the gardeners to the general manager are great - friendly, professional and cannot do enough for you. The hotel is stunning, immaculate throughout and the view from our room overlooking the sea was beautiful. The main pool was our favourite place to be during the day, plenty of beds whatever time you turn up - though a trip to the beach has to be done.
reviews.title: The Baron Resort Hotel is incredible providing outstanding service a thoroughly relaxing environment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food in the Sinai restaurant (buffet) was very good and catered for all tastes, however fussy! The service in here was superb, we were looked after every day by Samy, Naser and Ibrihim and i can honestly say we've never had such good service anywhere - they work so hard but always have a smile for everyone and nothing is too much trouble. We also ate in the Indian, Italian and Seafood restaurants and these too are well worth a visit. I agree with some of the other reviews that the night time entertainment is a bit limited but that's about the only negative i can think of and even then we didn't really care, we were happy to totally relax and have early nights and early mornings.
reviews.title: Perfect place for great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Went to stay with 6 other friends. We had lots to celebrate with birthdays and anniversaries but was disappointed with this hotel. We normally would stay at Hilton Sharks Bay which is just along the road but 1 of the other group had already booked this hotel so we joined them there. We found the hotel clean and the room was quite big, but the drinks were prohibitvely expensive although the staff were friendly and helpful, although on those prices I would expect them to be! We booked through Thomson (wouldn't recommend their flight meals as they were inedible). We booked into their health club for a massage and had terrible trouble, they had overbooked and we waited for 1.5 hrs and then never got a massage at all. I would strongly recommend keep away from this part of the hotel complex as they are rude, abusive even when they are in the wrong. The beach was much larger than sharks bay but wouldn't go there with my children as they would lose me! Sharks Bay is much more compact and much safer with children, we went without children this time, and sharks bay is a much more pleasant experience. We noticed this time that there is no hassle at the airport with egyptians trying to give you a trolley and also in Naama Bay the hassle is much less than in the previous 3 years that we have been and a much more pleasant experience. The old peugeot taxis have all been removed as they were deemed unsafe but make sure you haggle all price trips before getting into any taxis. We found the food much more pleasant at Sharks Bay with the exception of the Indian which was very good. Will be going back to sharks bay in august for the 4th time and would recommend it to everyone,
reviews.title: Not as good as Hilton Sharks Bay

likes.disliked: — A lot of walking to breakfast restaurant/beach/toilets!

reviews.title: Ultimate Chillout
reviews.text: My wife and I have been going to the Baron Resort (Hotel) for the past 7 years on a bed & breakfast basis and have always found it to be a wonderful place to relax. The accomodation is good and the gardens and surroundings are well kept and pleasant. The Area General Manager is a very nice and approachable man and the staff are generally friendly and helpful. Any minor problems have been generally resolved quickly. Examples include minor problems with room maintenance or food. The breakfast buffet is very good and I can highly recommend the Indian Restaurant for evening meals. The snorkelling is also very good and the coral reef can be easily accessed via a pontoon from the beach, which is in front of the hotel. Unfortunately some tourists still walk on the coral which can cause damage but at least the staff do act if they see it happening.

reviews.title: Worst Service ..no good food
reviews.text: Arrived at the Baron Hotel late afternoon of 3rd April. We stayed on a B&B basis, as I know HB and AI is available at this hotel. First room was 236, which faced the road, and was a twin as opposed to a double. Not ideal for a romantic getaway, so asked to be switched to a double overlooking the beach. This was done for an additonal £11 per night. Robe and slippers provided in each room. The room was cleaned everyday with the usual nice touches.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Cannot fault the breakfast in the mornings. Buffet style with everything you can think of, fresh fruit, eggs, waffles, crepes, yoghurt etc. Never any trouble to find a table, and tea and coffee served in a large flask, so definately more then 2 cups! Only groan is the non-smoking area is significantly smaller than the smoking!
reviews.title: Relaxing stay at fantastic Baron!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed at the Baron Resort for 2 weeks, cannot fault the hotel it is lovely, set on the coral reef, beach is nice, jetty to get out over the reef for snorkeling, we were on what they call premium all inclusive board basis which was good all the food was excellent, we also had free tickets for 1 meal each week in the indian restaurant, the italian and the egyptian which were all very good, we ate at the oasis pool bar every lunch time which was also good, the rooms are really nice we had one looking over the sea out to tiran island.
reviews.title: relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didnt manage to get a bed around the pool though for the whole stay, people were reserving them early in the morning which we didnt think should have been allowed really and as we are not early risers on holiday, we never managed to get one, we always got a bed on the beach though.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we cannot fault the hotel or the service we received, and would return again for some sunshine.
reviews.title: The best hotel for quality and snorkelling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one week and had an absolutely fantastic time! I was very impressed with the service from all of the staff, even the gardeners say hello and ask how your day is as you walk past. Every one was so friendly and helpful. If you are rude to them you will get worse service but being polite and friendly towards the staff gets you a long way! The animation team were very good and get everyone involved in some fun activities! The whole place was cleaned every day down to polishing the floors outside which I thought very impressive. Also the food was very nice, considering I am quite a fussy eater but I got on fine and they were helpful if you wanted to know what ingredients dishes contained. I would like to thank all who work there for making my stay fantastic, they all make you feel like a friend. Also the sea at this hotel is amazing, we walked up a few of the surrounding jetties and this one had the clearest water it was beautiful!
reviews.title: just returned wow what a place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Baron Resort 5 years running and intend returning again next year. The hotel rates very highly with us for quality and cleanliness. All the staff are friendly and helpful. Although there are several restaurants to choose from, we have always eaten in the main buffet restaurant where there is an excellent range of food with different themes each night. The hotel is situated on the delightful Ras Nasrani Bay where the snorkelling is excellent. We have in past years been out on snorkelling trips but now we just enjoy going out from the hotel beach where there is a beautiful coral garden and a fantastic range of fish.
reviews.title: BARON RESORT IS THE TOPS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great place, clean, very well maintained, happy helpful staff. Heated pool which is huge and great to swim, loads of sun beds, although due to daily brezes the good sheltered ones went early ( about 9 am ) they had towels on? food was good, we were on a Band B and the food during lunch and dinner was cheap ( 20 pounds for 2 people) rooms were big, some are garden views so we upgraded and it was well worth it, sea view with balcony, great showers in the room, about 10 english tv channels with music, sport and news and 3 film channels i think, i had a browse but it was my honeymoon ??? clientele were english , eouropean and russian but good attitude around hotel, some people were slightly rude but not sure if thats because us english are just so polite. My little tip would be to take a travel kettle as they dont have one in the room. The weather was hot, with a nice cool breeze somedays, evenings you need a sweater but its not that bad. Basically there is a little street to walk along but mainly hotel based. Great house reef for diving and snorkelling , very clear water and hardly any divers in the water. Overall we had a great time. One week is enough though due to its location, would recommend it as a couple get away and the only reason i would not go back is i never do. Hve fun
reviews.title: half term sun

likes.disliked: — could have a bigger gym and better bar

reviews.title: Wonderful food and people
reviews.text: There are a number of things which would make me want to return to the Baron Resort (and my friend and I intend to very soon). The food is wonderful (particularly the Egyptian dishes and the Indian restaurant)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: in all the restaurants we ate in and we enjoyed the variety on offer. I'm glad to say they haven't yet succumbed to the 'burger and chips' mentaility and I hope they don't try to cater for the usual Brits abroad palate. The staff are so friendly and contribute towards the enjoyment and pleasure. The pool is excellent as is the beach. The public areas of the hotel are also extremely attractive and the overall housekeeping is absolutely spotless - there are an army of staff continually cleaning everything in sight and it really pays off. Robes are provided in the room and a fresh beach towel provided daily on request - I like that! My only negative comments regarding the hotel are that the rooms - whilst spacious - lack the finesse and luxury that you would expect in a 5 star resort. Also, the gym facilities are poor. We were also very unhappy with the beauty treatments we had in the resort, although this was not the salon found within the hotel itself, it was on the boulevard. I also felt disappointed at being unable to swim in the sea straight from the shore, as you had to walk down the jetty and enter from there to avoid the coral. It's also impossible to go for a walk outside of the hotel because there's nothing there and the road is quite dangerous. There is also limited bar availability and so a trip to Naama Bay is the only option if you want some fun. That said, we intend to revisit and use the shuttle bus for a fun night out.
reviews.title: 2nd time around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was are second trip to this fantastic resort but this time around my wife and I invited my parents and the reson we did to share are experince and great time we ever had on the shores of the red sea in the baren resort.My parents had the best time they ever had for a long time they loved the indian restorants obove all and we injoyed are daily time on the beach and the night shows and just as the first time the staff and the managment was great servies was exelent the food was great and now my parents just asked me to book a second trip for them so i did.At the end i would like to thank all the men and women that worked at the resort.
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway
A Charming Hotel
reviews.text: Just back from a week at the Baron Resort and have to say I can't wait to go back. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis but only because I don't like being tied to a hotel for all my meals.

aka: Baron Resort Sharm El Sheikh Hotel
description: Here, the color of turquoise is made more striking against stretches of pure golden sand. This is a simple description of what you should expect at our five-star luxury Hotel. Over 600 meters of private sandy beach, 80,000 square meters of landscape and the exotic Tiran Island few kilometers from its front scene declaring an unforgettable memory of sunset, come together to embrace the charm of Baron Resort making it ‘A Haven for Pleasure.’ This award-winning hotel combines state-of-the-art facilities, quality services and welcoming staff to cater to needs of families and couples seeking an informal ambiance.
